Package cpsc2150.extendedCheckers.models

Interface ICheckerBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsCheckerBoard, CheckerBoard, CheckerBoardMem
public interface ICheckerBoard
An interface that does different actions of a game of checker. The first thing it does it can add viable direction to specific key of the directions hashmap. It can place piece on the board and it can check if a player has won. It can move a piece on the board and jump of piece if necessary. It can modify the piece count hashmap to take pieces away from a player. The interface can scan the positions around a position to check if there are pieces there. It can also return a position that if added to another will result in a move in desired direction.

  • Method Details

    • getViableDirections

      HashMap<Character,ArrayList<DirectionEnum>> getViableDirections()
      This function is used to access the hashmap that holds the viable directions that each player can move
      Returns:
      viableDirections with keys for a player piece and an ArrayList for the enumerated Directions class

    • getPieceCounts

      HashMap<Character,Integer> getPieceCounts()
      This function returns a HashMap that links players to the number of pieces they have left
      Returns:
      a HashMap that has keys for each player and values for number of pieces

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      This function finds what piece is on a specific square on the checkerboard
      Parameters:
      pos - BoardPosition object that has the row and column of the square that the function should look at
      Returns:
      a character that represent the player at that board position

    • placePiece

      void placePiece(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      This function sets each piece to its starting position on the board
      Parameters:
      pos - BoardPosition object that tells the function what place on the board the character needs to be placed
      player - a character that represents the player

      This function returns the number of rows that the board is made of as an integer
      Returns:

    • addViableDirections

      default void addViableDirections(char player, DirectionEnum dir)
      This function sets the directions that each player can move their pieces in the game
      Parameters:
      player - that represents the player that getting directions added to
      dir - DirectionEnum class that holds the valid directions a player can move

    • checkPlayerWin

      default boolean checkPlayerWin(Character player)
      This will check and see if all the other players still have pieces on board and if they do not then the player who does wins.
      Parameters:
      player - a character that represents the player
      Returns:
      True if the player has won and False if the player has not won

    • movePiece

      default BoardPosition movePiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      This function will move a piece from one position on the board to another position
      Parameters:
      startingPos - BoardPosition that tells where to find the piece to move
      dir - Direction Enum that tells what directions the piece can move
      Returns:
      a BoardPosition object that says the new position of the piece

    • jumpPiece

      default BoardPosition jumpPiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      This function will be used when the player is trying to jump a piece
      Parameters:
      startingPos - BoardPosition object that says where to locate the piece that is being moved
      dir - DirectionEnum object that holds the direction the piece is going to move
      Returns:
      BoardPosition object that represents the new position after the jump

    • playerLostPieces

      default void playerLostPieces(int numPieces, char player, HashMap<Character,Integer> pieceCounts)
      This function removes pieces from a player's total pieces
      Parameters:
      numPieces - which is the number of pieces that are going to be removed from pieceCounts
      player - character that the pieces are getting removed from
      pieceCounts - hashmap that holds how many pieces the players have left

    • scanSurroundingPositions

      default HashMap<DirectionEnum,Character> scanSurroundingPositions(BoardPosition startingPos)
      This function will scan the positions around a board position and return what piece is in every direction around that position
      Parameters:
      startingPos - BoardPosition object that the function wants to scan all the pieces around
      Returns:
      Hashmap with a direction and a character mapped to the direction

    • getDirection

      static BoardPosition getDirection(DirectionEnum dir)
      This function returns what to add to the row and column of a function to move it in a specific direction
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction that a piece wants to move
      Returns:
      the new position with 1 or a -1 added to the row and column
